titleStmt.title: Letter from Sol Lewis to John G. Neihardt, September 28, 1960
titleStmt.author: Lewis, Sol

div1.fw:
Antiquarian Press, Ltd.
303 Fourth Avenue, New York 10, N.Y. Algonquin 4-8494
45 West 57th Street
New York 19, N.Y.
div1.p: Thank you very kindly for your letter of 21 Sept.

I am enclosing your plane tickets, which I believe are self explanatory. You leave Columbia on Wed. morning Oct. 12th. at 8:51 A.M. on Ozark Air Lines Flight #58. Arrive in St.Louis at 10:49 A.M. Leave St.Louis at 12:15 P.M. on T.W.A. Flight #70. Arrive in N.Y. at 3:20 P.M. Please come directly to my office at 45 West 57th. St. Room 504.

As to the topic for your talk, we have already sent notices to our members announcing that you will speak on your Personal Relationships with Black Elk. This is a subject in which our members are keenly interested. We generally allow about 40 minutes to our speakers, so that if you would care to include some portion of your Cycle, we'd be delighted if you could fit it in.
Incidentally, since we would like to publish your talk in our Brand Book, I wonder if you have or will have your address in written form, or some notes which we could use?
I know that I speak for our entire membership when I say that we look forward most eagerly to the honor and pleasure of your company on Wed. eve. Oct.12th.
With every best wish and kindest regards,
div1.closer: Sincerely Sol Lewis P.S.- Since I do not know when or from where you will be returning home, I have included an "open" return ticket which may be used at any time from any place.
